About NYU
 /		Leadership  University Administration

 /		Executive Vice President for Finance  Information Technology

 /		Office of the Controller
 /		Office of the Bursar

The Office of the Bursar is the central billing and collection point for New York University. The department is responsible for managing the university billing, collecting, refunding and cashiering functions.

The Bursar's Office staff is available to assist students and parents with activities related to paying their bill and other financial services. They recognize that their office has a direct influence on how students and parents view the University as a whole, and they continue to strive to provide services in an efficient and timely manner.
Visit Bills, Payments, and Refunds on StudentLink for further information and resources from the Office of the Bursar.
Office of the Bursar Orgchart (PDF)

Anthony Bonano



University Bursar

anthony.bonano@nyu.edu

 /		Leadership  University Administration
 /		Office of the President
 /		Executive Vice President for Finance  Information Technology
 /		Financial Operations  Treasury
 /		Office of the Controller
 /		Global Tax Compliance

The mission of the Global Tax Compliance is: to ensure accurate tax reporting and withholding; to prepare exempt organization tax returns and University Unrelated Business Income Tax Returns; to provide advice and guidance on tax issues; and to review reports on payment of sales, real estate and payroll taxes.

Additionally, the Global Tax Compliance Department is charged with the responsibility to ensure that we comply with all federal, state, and city agency rules and requirements when it comes to payments to Foreign Nationals (also referred to as Nonresident Aliens). The Global Tax Compliance Department reviews all payments made via Payroll, Accounts Payable, and the Student Information System to ensure that we meet all reporting and withholding requirements. They also ensure that all Nonresident Aliens receiving payments from New York University meet all immigration requirements in order to receive payment.
Visit the Tax Guidance  Compliance on the FinanceLink website for further information and resources.

105 East 17th Street
New York, NY 10003
Global Tax Compliance Orgchart (PDF)

Louis Curcio



Senior Director

louis.curcio@nyu.edu

About NYU
 /		Leadership  University Administration
 /		Office of the President
 /		Executive Vice President for Finance  Information Technology
 /		Financial Operations  Treasury
 /		Office of the Controller
 /		Financial Accounting  Reporting
 /		Reconciliation  Analysis

Banking and Investment Reconciliation is responsible for domestic and global cash and investment account reconciliations. The investment accounts include but are not limited to uninvested cash, marketable securities, securities pending, gift annuities, and the endowment pool. In addition, this team performs the reconciliation of the student loan fund accounts.

Reconciliation and Analysis is responsible for the on-going reconciliation and analysis of general ledger accounts which includes but is not limited to accounts and loan receivables, other assets/payables and intercompany. Analysis of revenue and expenses is also a primary responsibility for this team. In addition, this area is responsible for facilitating the preparation of financial related requirements for external reports.

Nadlyn Jules



Manager, Reconciliation and Analysis 

nadlyn.jules@nyu.edu

 /		Leadership  University Administration

 /		Office of the Controller
 /		Financial Accounting  Reporting
 /		Global Accounting  Reporting
The Global Accounting and Reporting team is responsible for ensuring timely and accurate account reconciliation and financial reporting for the global sites and portal campuses.
Services include:

• Global cash and investment account reconciliations
• Reconciliation and analysis of global general ledger accounts
• Preparation and review of global financial statements
• Liaison for all global external and internal audits
• General accounting and reporting support to global sites and portal campuses ensuring compliance with generally accepted accounting principles and other regulatory requirements.

Debby Lara



Manager, Global Accounting  Reporting

debby.lara@nyu.edu

About NYU
 /		Leadership  University Administration

 /		Financial Accounting  Reporting
 /		General  Restricted Accounting

General  Restricted Accounting has ownership of centralized accounting for all operational, designated, and restricted funds. The General Accounting area is responsible for all operating funds, foundations, real estate, auxiliaries, agencies and services centers. The Restricted Accounting area includes designated funds, endowments and the spending distribution, and student loans.

This team’s primary goal is to provide the highest quality of cost effective support and deliverables to our internal customers, while ensuring the integrity of the general ledger and compliance with internal and external regulations. The team serves as the main point of contact for accounting support to Fiscal Officers and Administrators for technical guidance, issue resolution, and general accounting process questions and guidance.
Contact us for General Accounting at CDV.Fund10@nyu.edu and Restricted Accounting at CDV.Fund20@nyu.edu, and CDV.Fund22@nyu.edu.

Ashley Levine



Manager, General and Restricted Accounting 
212-998-2962
al140@nyu.edu

About NYU
 /		Leadership  University Administration
 /		Office of the President
 /		Executive Vice President for Finance  Information Technology
 /		Financial Operations  Treasury
 /		Office of the Controller
 /		Financial Accounting  Reporting
 /		Capital Accounting  Financial Reporting
Financial Accounting and Reporting has ownership of consolidated financial reporting, capital asset accounting, banking and investment reconciliations and general ledger reconciliation and analysis.

Financial Reporting is responsible for the preparation, review and analysis of the University’s consolidated financial statements. The team is the liaison for all related external and internal audits including ensuring compliance with generally accepted accounting principles and other regulatory requirements.

Capital Asset Accounting is responsible for the general ledger maintenance, reconciliation and analysis of all capital assets which includes land, buildings, furniture, equipment and construction in progress. This area also performs the accounting and analysis for all capital financing which includes external tax exempt debt.
Please send all questions regarding Funds 10, 20, 22 and 56 to their designated email addresses(listed below). This will help Financial Reporting to expedite your requests.

Fund 10: CDV.Fund10@nyu.edu 
Fund 20: CDV.Fund20@nyu.edu 
Fund 22: CDV.Fund22@nyu.edu
Fund 56: CDV.Fund56@nyu.edu

Kevin Shortt



Manager, Capital Accounting and Financial Reporting 

ks138@nyu.edu

 /		Financial Accounting  Reporting

The mission of the Financial Accounting  Reporting team is to provide professional financial accounting and reporting expertise to internal and external customers in support of NYU’s overall mission and goals. Our mission will be accomplished by delivery of value-added services and products in a cost efficient, integrated and flexible infrastructure, guided by effective internal controls and financial integrity.
Visit the Accounting  Reporting on the FinanceLink website for further information and resources
